title: Edwin Van der Sar open to Manchester United return in the future
text:
Van der Sar has been linked with a return to United (Picture: Getty)

Edwin Van der Sar has admitted he is interested in a return to Manchester United in the future.

United have put plans to hire a director of football on hold after months of searching, with Van der Sar reportedly a top target.

The Dutchman is currently employed at Ajax and although he would relish a return to Old Trafford, Van der Sar hinted he wasn’t keen on the idea of becoming United’s director of football.

‘I am a chief executive – and that is a very different role to director of football,’ he said.

Woodward appears to have put his search for a director of football on hold (Picture: Getty)

‘Besides my wife and children I have two loves in my life. They are Ajax and Manchester United.

‘Ajax scouted me, gave me the chance to become their No 1 goalkeeper.

Advertisement

‘Manchester United gave me the chance to make even bigger steps and develop at an even higher level.

‘So of course I am interested in a position at United. But I think I need to learn a little bit more about myself as a chief executive at Ajax and develop myself even further.

‘United is a fantastic club. So let’s see what the future brings.’

United chief Ed Woodward reportedly considered a host of names before revealing last month he had cooled his search for a director of football.

Solskjaer goes direct to Woodward with transfer targets (Picture: Getty)

‘Regarding the speculation around the head of football, we are continually reviewing and looking at the potential to evolve our structure on the football side,’ Woodward said.

‘Much of the speculation around this type of role revolves around recruitment – an area that we’ve evolved in recent years.

‘As we’ve already mentioned, we feel the players we’ve signed in the summer demonstrate this approach is the right one.’
description: Edwin Van der Sar has admitted he is interested in a return to Manchester United in the future. United have put plans to hire a director of football on hold...
